A [*locally compact quantum group*]{} defined as in ref. [@LV2k3] is a
*quadruple ${\mathcal G}= (A, \Delta, \mu, \nu)$*, where $A$ is either a
$C^*$– or a $\Delta: A \to A \otimes A$ and two faithful semi-finite
normal weights, $\mu$ and $\nu$ –[*right and -left Haar measures*]{}.

### Examples

1.  An ordinary unimodular group $G$ with Haar measure $ \mu$.
    $A := L^{\infty}(G, \mu), \Delta: f(g) \mapsto f(gh)$,
    $S: f(g) \mapsto f(g^{}-1), \phi(f) = \int_G f(g)d\mu (g)$, where
    $g, h \in G, f \in L^{\infty}(G, \mu)$.

2.  A:= Ł(G) is the von Neumann algebra generated by left-translations
    $L_g$ or by left convolutions $L_f :={ \int}_G f(g)L_g d \mu (g)$
    with continuous functions
    $f(.) \in L^1(G,\mu) \Delta: \mapsto L_g \otimes L_g \mapsto L_g^{-1}, \phi(f) = f(e) $,
    where $g \in G$, and e is the unit of G.
